author: Staff Reporter
text:
Life Insurance Corporation of India’s new scheme “Jeevan Pragati” was launched by the Salem Division here on Wednesday.

Addressing the media, LIC’s Senior Divisional Manager M. Mohana Perumal said that the plan was a non-linked assurance plan in which risk cover keeps increasing every five years.

Sum assured

The minimum basic sum assured is Rs. 1.50 lakh while there is no limit for maximum basic sum assured.

The minimum policy term is 12 years while the maximum policy term is 20 years.

Persons in the age group of 12 to 45 are eligible under the plan while accidental death and disability benefit rider is available on payment of additional premium.

He said that on survival at the end of the policy term, the maturity benefit was sum assured on maturity plus simple reversionary bonus plus final additional bonus would be paid to the policy holder.

Loan

Also loan can be obtained after three years and the policy can be surrendered after three years of full premium payment.

Premium paid under the scheme was eligible for tax rebate under section 80C. Commercial Manager D. Jeyabose and other employees were present during the launch of the plan.
title: LIC launches new scheme
